brainvr.R 0.1.1
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Brainvr.R showcase of loading and preprocessing

Reference

All functions

add_limits()

Checks if object has map limits variable and adds plot limits if so

BrainvrObject()

Title

export_player_log()

Exports preprocessed player log

get_log(<brainvr>)

Returns entire player log

get_log_timewindow(<brainvr>)

Returns log between designated times

get_trial_distance(<brainvr>)

Returns walked distance in a particular trial

get_trial_duration(<brainvr>)

Returns how long the trial took and removes potential pauses in the log

get_trial_log(<brainvr>)

Returns data.table with player log for a particular trial

get_trial_times(<brainvr>)

Gets start and finish times of trial

is_player_preprocessed()

Returns if the player log has been preprocessed

load_experiment()

Loads files form a folder into BrainvrObject

load_experiments()

Goes through the folder and loads every experiment info into separate object

load_experiment_info()

Loads particular info file into a list

load_experiment_log()

Loads expeirment log into a predefined list

mirror_axes()

Mirrors X and Y to negative and recomputes rotation

open_experiment_info()

Searches the directory for experiment log files. Returs single one if multiple are found

open_experiment_logs()

Iterates over all _test_ files in a folder asnd saves them one by one to a return list

open_player_log()

Searches a directory for a player log. Returns player log data.table

plot_trial_path(<brainvr>)

Plots trial path

preprocess_player_log()

preprocesses player log and returns if it changed. Passes by referennce

resize_layout()

Resizes the map to fit the new constraints.

save_preprocessed_player()

Saves preprocessed player ot hte given folder. Receives either specific name, or gets the name from already present player logs If there are multiple player logs in the folder,takes the name from the first available

smooth_positions.brainvr()

Smooths positions and recalculates distances

translate_positions()

Moves all positions to correspond to the new 0, 0 coordinate

was_trial_force_finished()

REturns if the trial has been force finished

  • All functions
